<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/25/trade-deal-drama-g7-summit?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Walking the Minefield at the G7 Summit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Walking the Minefield at the G7 Summit" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY2NzYyNTIzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pass the salt</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We could write another story about how President Trump "<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-suggests-second-thoughts-about-trade-war-11566728236?mod=djemalertNEWS&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">regrets</a> not raising the tariffs higher" on China...but there's an entire <em>planet </em>of trade negotiations begging for the Brew treatment. Let's check in on some of the world's largest economies as they wrap up the G7 summit in France today. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Starting with France...</strong>President Trump <a href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1165396410021437442?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declared</a> his Saturday lunch with host/French President Emmanuel Macron was "the <span>best meeting we have yet had</span>," but that might have been before they got the bill. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Trump threatened tariffs on French wine in response to France's digital tax on Big Tech companies like Google and Facebook. European Council President Donald Tusk </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/24/donald-tusk-eu-will-retaliate-if-us-imposes-tariffs-on-france-over-digital-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> Europe would respond "in kind" if the other Donald goes through with it. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brazil </strong>also commanded lots of attention. Germany and Britain are <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-g7-summit-mercosur/britain-joins-germany-in-criticizing-macrons-mercosur-threat-idUSKCN1VE0ON?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pushing back</a> on Macron's threat to block a landmark trade deal with South American countries over Brazil's handling of fires ravaging the Amazon rainforest. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In the U.K.,</strong> Prime Minister Boris Johnson's juggling chainsaws: avoiding a no-deal Brexit while creating a trade deal with the U.S. that doesn't irk EU leaders.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Trump, who supports Brexit, met with Johnson Sunday. Their officials will continue to work on "</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/25/trump-at-g7-hints-at-very-big-trade-deal-with-britain-post-brexit.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a very big trade deal</a></span><span>" for when the U.K. says adiEU. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trump <a href="https://www.politico.com/story/2019/08/25/us-japan-trade-deal-g7-1474461?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> Sunday that a trade deal with <strong style="color:#000">Japan</strong> involving industrial tariffs, agriculture, and digital trade "is done in principle." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Canada's</strong> back on the nice list. Trump left last year's summit in Canada early with choice words for PM Justin Trudeau. This year, the pair had an amicable meeting, <a href="https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/trudeau-trade-talk-trump-1.5259210?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">touting</a> the USMCA trade agreement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>While the G7 summit used to present a more united front, it's harder—but not impossible—to find common ground on global economic issues today.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F08%2F25%2Ftrade-deal-drama-g7-summit" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Let%27s+check+on+the+world%27s+largest+economies+as+they+wrap+up+the+G7+summit&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/25/trade-deal-drama-g7-summit&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FASHION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/25/fashions-trending-green-g7?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Fashion's Trending Green at the G7
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Fashion's Trending Green at the G7" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY1MzY1OTQwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Believe it or not, tariffs aren’t the only item on the G7 agenda. Today, 32 companies representing around 150 fashion brands are <a href="https://fortune.com/2019/08/23/fashion-companies-reach-sustainable-fashion-accord-g7-summit/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">presenting</a> a sustainability pact for a greener future.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who's signing:</strong> High fashion (Chanel, Prada, <span>Hermès</span>), fast fashion (H&M, Zara parent Inditex), and sweat fashion (Nike, Adidas). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They're led by François-Henri Pinault, a French luxury billionaire and CEO of Kering, the parent company of Balenciaga, Gucci, and Alexander McQueen. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Who's not signing: LVMH, the largest luxury group by sales. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What they want: </strong>1) guidelines addressing the sector’s <a href="https://unfccc.int/news/fashion-industry-un-pursue-climate-action-for-sustainable-development?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">oversized impact</a> on climate, oceans, and biodiversity 2) industry-wide participation to achieve zero emissions by 2050 and 3) increased transparency and accountability. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There's always a but </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As you might've picked up from "guidelines," the G7 Fashion Pact is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/23/fashion/environment-crisis-pact-kering-g7.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">voluntary</a> and toothless in its enforcement for signatories that fail to meet targets (which, right now, are vague). Business of Fashion <a href="https://www.businessoffashion.com/articles/news-analysis/kering-chief-to-present-industry-sustainability-pact-to-g7?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">notes</a> the agreement "represents the latest in a growing list of industry initiatives that have so far generated lofty goals, but limited tangible change." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Want more business of fashion? Sign up for our twice-weekly Retail Brew newsletter with one click <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/welcome/?utm_source=morning_brew&sailthru_lists[{u(%27Retail" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. </em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/25/toyota-unveils-line-electric-vehicles-2020-olympics?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Toyota Shows Off New Toys for the Olympics
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Toyota announced its <a href="https://pressroom.toyota.com/toyota-provides-diverse-mobility-for-tokyo-2020-including-a-full-line-up-of-electrified-vehicles/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">full lineup</a> of vehicles to help people get around the 2020 Tokyo Olympic and Paralympic Games next summer. Close to 90% of the fleet—which includes scooters, mopeds, buses, and more—will be <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/8/23/20830105/toyota-electric-vehicles-2020-olympics-ev-scooter?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">electrified</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here's the autonomous e-Palette that will shuttle athletes and staff around the Olympic Village. Keep it PG in there.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/k9k-uGBOxrfPbM59Kll24o2b2_2dQOa4ASmvK62EhkvMUXLHAHBypM6kNgvG3LuAwuB8DtYXzeQOO4SsudXan2sAga81b0TEDNrfCgp8TbpxLNZSKpBsg9xbL_iyvMekD8zbXk1c" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Toyota</em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then, take a look at Concept-i, the car that will carry the Olympic torch on one leg of the journey. Its <a href="https://www.digitaltrends.com/cars/toyota-hydrogen-fuel-cell-vehicles-and-electric-cars-at-2020-tokyo-olympics/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">defining feature</a> is Yui, an artificial intelligence interface that can read your emotions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/bhjC8Ba_jbYG4JkRuChs37pfG6KL4mHUw3PlzsxtezeUkh18FPOQC4f-UufjIgpLp8ixMMeDSGEShzVCHZOxD9Vp21yc2er7tB-RXvDyS63jGeUIY6DWds2EudWtbEJwbW8-zVWn" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><sup class="sub-text">Toyota</sup> </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out, </strong>via <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/8/23/20830105/toyota-electric-vehicles-2020-olympics-ev-scooter?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Verge</a>: "Toyota...was a pioneer in the field of alternative fuels, with the release of the hybrid Prius in 1997. But since then it has lagged behind in the race to release premium and mass-market electric vehicles, having been overtaken by Tesla, GM, Nissan, and others."</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/25/sinclair-completes-acquisition-fox-assets-disney?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Sinclair Likes Sports, and We Don't Care Who Knows
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sinclair, the owner of 191 TV stations nationwide, completed its <a href="https://variety.com/2019/tv/news/sinclair-closes-purchase-fox-regional-sports-networks-disney-1203312211/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$9.6 billion acquisition </a>of 21 Fox Regional Sports Networks (RSNs) on Friday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...but not from Fox. Disney gained control of the RSNs via its $71.3 billion purchase of 21st Century Fox assets. However, the government told Disney it couldn't own ESPN <em>and </em>all the local channels ESPN is trying to put out of business, so Disney sold them to Sinclair. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it's a big deal: </strong>These networks form the largest cluster of regional sports networks on the market and include the exclusive local rights to 42 professional sports teams in the NBA, NHL, and MLB. Together, the networks <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/bradadgate/2019/05/03/some-takeaways-from-sinclairs-acquisition-of-fox-regional-sports-networks/?utm_source=morning_brew#1dc5838e2596?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">generated $3.8 billion</a> in revenue in 2018.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Local sports programming, especially when the hometown team is winning games, can be helpful to station owners navigating the streaming revolution. That's why Sinclair is looking to tack on even more regional sports outlets from AT&T, the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/sinclair-eyes-more-regional-sports-networks-as-disney-deal-closes-11566583416?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ reports</a>.</p>

CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/25/week-ahead-august-26?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Syllabus Week Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong>Durable goods; U.S. Open begins; MTV Video Music Awards </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Consumer confidence; the Pumpkin Spice Latte is back at Starbucks </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Earnings (Coty, Five Below, Tiffany, Box); Venice International Film Festival begins</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Second estimate of Q2 GDP; Disney’s <em>Star Wars </em>theme park opens in Orlando; earnings (TD Bank, Dollar Tree, Dollar General, Workday, Dell, Best Buy, Ulta); one week until NFL football </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Earnings (Campbell Soup); Islamic New Year begins at sundown; it's Labor Day Weekend; Happy 89th Warren Buffett!</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/25/share-brew-great-cause?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Share the Brew for a Great Cause

</h1>

<img alt="Share the Brew for a Great Cause" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY2NzQ1NDg3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>What he said</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For every new reader who signs up to the Brew this week, we’re going to donate $1 to <a href="https://www.donorschoose.org/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">DonorsChoose.org</a>, a nonprofit that helps public school teachers fund classroom projects and programs. They’ve been around since 2000 and have funded nearly 1.5 million projects.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Not sure how to start? </strong>Copy and paste the message below to your network.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>“Morning Brew, an awesome business newsletter I love reading, is running a campaign this week in partnership with DonorsChoose.org</em>—<em>a nonprofit </em><em>that helps teachers fund classroom projects and programs.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>For every person who subscribes to Morning Brew’s free daily email, they’ll donate $1 to DonorsChoose. You can sign up through this link: <a href="Hi%20all!%20Morning%20Brew%20is%20running%20a%20partnership%20with%20DonorsChoose.org%20this%20week%20to%20support%20your%20efforts%20to%20#clearthelists!%20%20%20For%20every%20signup%20to%20our%20free%20daily%20newsletter,%20we%20are%20donating%20%241%20to%20DonorsChoose.%20%20%20You%20can%20learn%20more%20and%20sign%20up%20here:%20https://www.morningbrew.com/back2school/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">morningbrew.com/back2school</a>.” </em></p>
<p class="c-mrkdwn__pre" data-stringify-type="pre" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Or, click the big share button below to seamlessly share on your platform of choice.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>By sharing the Brew, you’ll help improve classroom experiences all over the country. (And yes, you’ll also up your referral count.)</p>

salt\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe could write another story about how President Trump \"\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-suggests-second-thoughts-about-trade-war-11566728236?mod=djemalertNEWS\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eregrets\u003c/a\u003e not raising the tariffs higher\" on China...but there's an entire \u003cem\u003eplanet \u003c/em\u003eof trade negotiations begging for the Brew treatment. Let's check in on some of the world's largest economies as they wrap up the G7 summit in France today. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStarting with France...\u003c/strong\u003ePresident Trump \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1165396410021437442?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeclared\u003c/a\u003e his Saturday lunch with host/French President Emmanuel Macron was \"the \u003cspan\u003ebest meeting we have yet had\u003c/span\u003e,\" but that might have been before they got the bill. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTrump threatened tariffs on French wine in response to France's digital tax on Big Tech companies like Google and Facebook. European Council President Donald Tusk \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/24/donald-tusk-eu-will-retaliate-if-us-imposes-tariffs-on-france-over-digital-tax.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Europe would respond \"in kind\" if the other Donald goes through with it. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBrazil \u003c/strong\u003ealso commanded lots of attention. Germany and Britain are \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-g7-summit-mercosur/britain-joins-germany-in-criticizing-macrons-mercosur-threat-idUSKCN1VE0ON?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epushing back\u003c/a\u003e on Macron's threat to block a landmark trade deal with South American countries over Brazil's handling of fires ravaging the Amazon rainforest. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIn the U.K.,\u003c/strong\u003e Prime Minister Boris Johnson's juggling chainsaws: avoiding a no-deal Brexit while creating a trade deal with the U.S. that doesn't irk EU leaders.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTrump, who supports Brexit, met with Johnson Sunday. Their officials will continue to work on \"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/25/trump-at-g7-hints-at-very-big-trade-deal-with-britain-post-brexit.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea very big trade deal\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\" for when the U.K. says adiEU. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTrump \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/story/2019/08/25/us-japan-trade-deal-g7-1474461?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e Sunday that a trade deal with \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJapan\u003c/strong\u003e involving industrial tariffs, agriculture, and digital trade \"is done in principle.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCanada's\u003c/strong\u003e back on the nice list. Trump left last year's summit in Canada early with choice words for PM Justin Trudeau. This year, the pair had an amicable meeting, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/trudeau-trade-talk-trump-1.5259210?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etouting\u003c/a\u003e the USMCA trade agreement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp G7 agenda. Today, 32 companies representing around 150 fashion brands are \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2019/08/23/fashion-companies-reach-sustainable-fashion-accord-g7-summit/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epresenting\u003c/a\u003e a sustainability pact for a greener future.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho's signing:\u003c/strong\u003e High fashion (Chanel, Prada, \u003cspan\u003eHermès\u003c/span\u003e), fast fashion (H\u0026M, Zara parent Inditex), and sweat fashion (Nike, Adidas). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey're led by François-Henri Pinault, a French luxury billionaire and CEO of Kering, the parent company of Balenciaga, Gucci, and Alexander McQueen. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWho's not signing: LVMH, the largest luxury group by sales. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat they want: \u003c/strong\u003e1) guidelines addressing the sector’s \u003ca href=\"https://unfccc.int/news/fashion-industry-un-pursue-climate-action-for-sustainable-development?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoversized impact\u003c/a\u003e on climate, oceans, and biodiversity 2) industry-wide participation to achieve zero emissions by 2050 and 3) increased transparency and accountability. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere's always a but \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs you might've picked up from \"guidelines,\" the G7 Fashion Pact is \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/23/fashion/environment-crisis-pact-kering-g7.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evoluntary\u003c/a\u003e and toothless in its enforcement for signatories that fail to meet targets (which, right now, are vague). Business of Fashion \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessoffashion.com/articles/news-analysis/kering-chief-to-present-industry-sustainability-pact-to-g7?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enotes\u003c/a\u003e the agreement \"represents the latest in a growing list of industry initiatives that have so far generated lofty goals, but limited tangible change.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eWant more business of fashion?
